content.json:
# Observability and Monitoring Main Dashboard
This workbook has been created to provide a consolidated view of microservices observability

It contains two main sections. The first one displays the Exceptions made from any of the components involved in the whole system.

Second section can redirect you to two more workbooks that are more focused on Infrastructure or System's behaviour to get a deeper insight of data collected.

parameters.name: Show
parameters.query:
datatable(x:string, y:string)[
"['New Failure Rate (%)'], ['Existing Failure Rate (%)']", 'New and Existing Failures',
"['New Failure Rate (%)']", 'Only New Failures',
"['Existing Failure Rate (%)']", 'Only Existing Failures',
]

parameters.name: UseComparisonTimeRangeOf
ProblemFilter
parameters.query:
exceptions
| where timestamp {OverTimeRange}
| summarize Count = count() by problemId
| order by Count desc
| project v = problemId, t = problemId, s=false
| union (datatable(v:string, t:string, s:boolean)[
'*', 'All Exceptions', true
])

parameters.name: Source
parameters.query:
datatable(x:string, y:string)[
'1 == 1', 'Server and Client Exceptions',
'client_Type <> "Browser"', 'Only Server Exceptions',
'client_Type == "Browser"', 'Only Client Exceptions',
]

content.query:
let cpu = performanceCounters
| where name == "% Processor Time Normalized"
| summarize CPU=avg(value) by cloud_RoleName;
let ioRate = performanceCounters
| where name == "IO Data Bytes/sec"
| summarize ioRate=avg(value) by cloud_RoleName;
let memory = performanceCounters
| where name == "Available Bytes"
| summarize Memory=avg(value) by cloud_RoleName;
let requests = requests
| summarize req_Duration=avg(duration), requestsCount = count() by cloud_RoleName;
let average = dependencies
| summarize average = avg(duration), dependenciesCount = count() by cloud_RoleName;
average
| join kind=fullouter requests on cloud_RoleName
| join kind=fullouter memory on cloud_RoleName 
| join kind=fullouter ioRate on cloud_RoleName
| join kind=fullouter cpu on cloud_RoleName
| project Service_Name=cloud_RoleName, CPU=iff(isnull(CPU), "N/A", strcat(bin(CPU, 0.01), " %")), Memory=iff(isnull(Memory), "N/A", format_bytes(Memory, 2, "GB")), IO_Rate=iff(isnull(ioRate), "N/A", strcat(bin(ioRate, 0.01), " B/s")), Avg_Dependency=iff(isnull(average), "N/A", strcat(bin(average, 0.01), " ms")), Dependencies_Count=iff(isnull(dependenciesCount), "N/A", tostring(dependenciesCount)), Req_Duration=iff(isnull(req_Duration), "N/A", strcat(bin(req_Duration, 0.01), " ms")), Requests_Count=iff(isnull(requestsCount), "N/A", tostring(requestsCount))

content.json:
## Additional workbooks

There are two workbooks made to keep track of the entire system's information.

|Workbooks|Descriiption|Link|
|---------|------------|----|
|Infrastructure|Data related to infrastructure|[Link](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/AppInsightsExtension/UsageNotebookBlade/ComponentId/${logs_workspace_id}/ConfigurationId/${infrastructure_workbook_id}/Type/workbook/WorkbookTemplateName/Infrastructure)|
|System|Data related to system functionality|[Link](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/AppInsightsExtension/UsageNotebookBlade/ComponentId/${logs_workspace_id}/ConfigurationId/${system_workbook_id}/Type/workbook/WorkbookTemplateName/System%20Processing)|
